abstracts.cdata!:
The Tax Administration Technical
            Assistance Loan Project for Argentina achieved a
            satisfactory overall outcome. Sustainability is rated as
            likely, and institutional development impact as substantial.
            The Bank's performance is rated as satisfactory because
            project restructuring and intensified supervision succeeded
            in correcting initial weaknesses in design. After a shaky
            start, the Borrower executed the project satisfactorily.
            Continuing changes in senior management delayed project
            execution, and resulted in two distinct implementation
            phases. Very little progress was achieved during the first
            phase from November 1988 to November 1990. During the second
            phase, from November 1990 until the end of the project in
            March 1994, implementation proceeded swiftly under the
            direction of a new and committed management team and project
            implementation unit. The Large Taxpayer Collection System
            was successfully introduced under the General Tax
            Directorate and expanded to other agencies. Other
            successfully implemented components include studies of
            evasion trends in specific economic sectors, training of
            staff, recruitment of personnel, and acquisition of computer
            equipment. Lessons learned from this project fall into three
            categories: (i) difficulties in the implementation of tax
            administration projects; (ii) critical issues for
            sustainability; and (iii) best practices in tax
            administration. The two most important lessons are that: (a)
            political stability is particularly important for
            implementation of technical assistance operations; and (b)
            improved civil service incentives, including adequate pay
            and career development, are a must to achieve improved tax administration.
